title: How to Make Modelling Dough from Bread and Glue

steps.headline: Trim the crust away from a slice of white bread.
Cover the slice of bread with a layer of white glue.
steps.description: The amount will be about 1 tablespoon, more or less depending on how moist or dry the bread may be.

steps.headline: Squish the bread and glue until it is the consistency of clay.
At this point you may add color.
steps.description: A few drops of vegetable dye or food coloring will do.

steps.headline: Keep squishing until the texture is very fine and smooth.
While the dough is moist, create flower petals, leaves or other sculptures.
Allow the bread dough objects to dry thoroughly.
If desired, cover dried art objects with a clear protective coat, such as shellac, acrylic spray, nail polish, etc.
